resources.string: officially Tulancingo de Bravo; Otomi: Ngu̱hmu.
Tulancingo is the second-largest city in the Mexican state of Hidalgo.
It is located in the southeastern part of Hidalgo state, 93 km from Mexico City. 20°5′0″N 98°22′0″W
Last known population is ≈ 151,584. About 75% of the municipality’s population of 129,935 lives in the city proper.
Temperate to cold with an annual average temperature of 14C and average rainfall of between 500 and 550 mm per year.
Cultural events, coffe places and stores.
If you want to drink a good coffee or just walk around to discover some free event, this is the place you need to go.

Every thursday, farmers around the 84 municipalities come to sell their organic products. This market is a big tradition in the town and lots of people visit the city to sell an buy all kind of products.

It is the old railway station of Tulancingo, which shows railway times of the late nineteenth and early twentieth century. In the present it is a museum that exhibits photographs of the construction of the station as well as office and accounting objects that were used at that time.
Modern art in the walls of the city.
Modern art is present in the walls of the city, you can just walk around the city to enjoy this painted.
Is a small mining town, and one of the 84 municipalities of Hidalgo, in the State of Hidalgo in east-central Mexico. 54km from Tulancingo.
The Prismas Basálticos of Santa María Regla are a rock formation on which falls a small jump that is located in the Hidalgo municipality of Huasca de Ocampo.
Old village, cultural groups in Mesoamerica.

This village is very old as human settlement, occupied by various cultural groups in Mesoamerica. Most village women wear girdles from small to hold the diaper, and when they grow their skirt or petticoat, is a tradition.
Prey located close to Acaxochitlán, Hidalgo.
It is a prey located 12 km southeast of the Main Plaza of Acaxochitlán, Hidalgo. There are boat ride on the lake to sport fishing and ride on horseback availables.
Located four km from the town of Huasca, Construction began in 1762 as a silver operation.
Is located in the Municipality of Metepec.
Is located in the Municipality of Metepec (in the State of Hidalgo). Popular for hot air balloon flights.
Variety of Mexican and International dishes. Juarez Sur 201.
Res and seafood buffet. Miguel Hidalgo 112
Italian Food & Pizza. Avenida del Trabajo 118.
